elements.2211.03050_b02b769a37612a94e5a14003ccd26: A macroscopic thermodynamic system always tend to relax to the thermal equilibrium state after a long enough time in spite of its initial time
elements.2211.03050_7f5d7fcd85df014b00e1ae062720f: However, it is also known that an isolated quantum system with a finite number of degrees of freedom (DoF) follows the unitary evolution, as a result, the full many body system always keeps a constant entropy as its initial state, which looks different from the above macroscopic relaxation behavior, unless certain specific averaging approaches are taken into consideration, e.g., based on time or random defect configurations

elements.2211.03050_bdc710a85963538dcc1c601764f95: Thus, the second law statement that the irreversible entropy keeps increasing could be equivalently understood as the increase of total correlation in this whole system
elements.2211.03050_45cda981e9f1761814088b0f5c2dc: If the correlation between the different DoF inside the bath is significant, corrections should be considered
elements.2211.03050_28ab6210fbeaffedb13b854410d4d: In practice, usually it is the partial information (e.g., marginal distribution, few-body observable expectations) that is directly accessible to our observation
elements.2211.03050_372a55235624536b4b434321c1670: Indeed most macroscopic thermodynamic quantities are obtained only from such partial information like the one-body distribution, which exhibits irreversible behaviors
elements.2211.03050_9a1dff6dd671b3fc4bcf65d9e5e02: In practical measurements, the dynamics of the full many body state is quite difficult to be measured directly
elements.2211.03050_01e822c5d8c8f293b856fe29ead7b: In this sense, the reversibility of microscopic dynamics and the macroscopic irreversibility coincide with each other.

elements.2211.03050_0f7a4b8c15da61c58b4439314e19e: Quantum information, correlation, local relaxation, Ising model
elements.2211.03050_4d77d2fb8f09527d89e7f7b0b9f22: A macroscopic thermodynamic system always tends to relax to the thermal equilibrium state after a long enough time in spite of its initial state
elements.2211.03050_7302a5fb956b6ffc02b985d7348d8: However, it is also known that an isolated quantum system with a finite number of degrees of freedom (DoF) follows the unitary evolution
elements.2211.03050_0cd620289dc989e62551609db0ed9: As a result, the full many body system always keeps a constant entropy as its initial state, which looks different from the above macroscopic relaxation behavior, unless certain specific averaging approaches are taken into consideration, e.g., based on time or random defect configurations
elements.2211.03050_90544d8c425159ba2d43a9ac73c6f: On the other hand, when focusing on the local parts of a many body system, the local dynamics naturally manifests similar relaxation behavior as the macroscopic thermodynamics
elements.2211.03050_dc656498dfd251bce205ec41bd996: For a finite system size, the local relaxation would come across a
elements.2211.03050_04890f3b6e427c9bbc544d64dd563: after a typical time: the well ordered oscillatory decay behavior suddenly appears
elements.2211.03050_1b88956938f38a4c845786b490450: With the increase of the system size, the recurrence appears much later, thus it does not show up in practice
elements.2211.03050_97346f80c62d2a687fddece6f666d: But the entropy of each local system cannot indicate the irreversible entropy production behavior either, since it increases and decreases from time to time
elements.2211.03050_ecdcbda297cae6e9494456e891bda: In comparison, it is found that the total correlation in the many body system
elements.2211.03050_bd2d3080ecc8105e15a6e52adea3b: could manifest the irreversible entropy production similar as the standard thermodynamics
elements.2211.03050_446f306af0b0302fad2b6b66385bc: In this paper, we study the dynamical behavior of the total correlation during the local relaxation in an
elements.2211.03050_6158ceb735b1c4d960cca69e999d2: In both strong and weak coupling regimes, which correspond to the two phases of the Ising model with distinct physical properties though, the system dynamics exhibits quite similar local relaxation and recurrence behaviors, except in the strong coupling case the system dynamics contains more violent fluctuations
elements.2211.03050_76639a4d8e5c72690cd04039ca279: Especially, it turns out the evolution of the total correlation roughly exhibits a monotonic increasing behavior in both strong and weak coupling cases, and approaches towards a steady value during the local relaxation process, which is similar to the irreversible entropy increase in the standard thermodynamics
elements.2211.03050_5d275bc25c7b3a3c2a93a7adf754d: Moreover, with the help of the Lagrangian multipliers, we calculate the possible maximum of the total correlation may achieve under proper constraints determined by the initial state, and it turns out such correlation maximization coincides quite well with the exact numerical result obtained from time dependent evolution
elements.2211.03050_022f6db1873b8a53358aebfdec037: In this sense, the correlational entropy production well corresponds to the irreversible entropy production in the standard thermodynamics
elements.2211.03050_d020409312ca0d45931be50f36495: We also show that in most common physical conditions, the correlational entropy production could reduce to the standard entropy production based on the thermal entropy
elements.2211.03050_e504ae323f0e44348f56778496386: 2 we study the dynamics of the Ising model

elements.2211.03050_9d3694d56cd48fd7766caa5b3fba7: Reducing to entropy production in standard thermodynamics
elements.2211.03050_79cff5bccb3032f8592ac24a3a622: Now we show that, under proper physical conditions, the total correlation could reduce to the entropy production in the standard thermodynamics
elements.2211.03050_69bf2c9306f28a5f9c8b2d7881a69: In most open system problems, we consider an open system interacting with a bath, and the bath is usually modeled as a collection of many noninteracting DoFs
elements.2211.03050_10ab5b8a779ccfeec1373a1658841: , which is weakly coupled with the open system, and it is assumed that the initial state of the bath is a canonical thermal state
elements.2211.03050_8f9fd6fa90cb427117117a2686c92: When the system-bath interaction strength is negligibly small, since the bath is much larger than the open system, the bath state
elements.2211.03050_181363ce63ad4d55eeb7ca8d4666e: would not change too much comparing with its initial one, thus
elements.2211.03050_189f6a9fef083c2b44ea4f2d60aec: , and the changing rate of the bath entropy can be approximately obtained as
elements.2211.03050_f4db176c59f61d80f84c6e3d76fa9: Notice that here the bath energy increase
elements.2211.03050_ace94c91554dce0d7381d028779ad: could reduce to the thermal entropy (up to a minus sign),
elements.2211.03050_b9114ae2439a6d0fb5e9da9fd9fe7: On the other hand, under the weak interactions, the different DoFs in the bath would not generate significant correlations during the evolution, thus approximately the bath entropy is just the summation of the entropy of each DoF,
elements.2211.03050_041cf7bd446a953abeac25110e516: is the reduced density state of a certain DoF in the bath
elements.2211.03050_1fbdbea748c6a6620c749d6f88662: Further, the open system plus the bath as a whole isolated system follows the unitary evolution, thus the entropy
elements.2211.03050_4579b63e336710b978d5fccd04f90: of the full system does not change with time
elements.2211.03050_66c71de71367449bb6665f13894b0: Thus, the changing rate of the total correlation gives
elements.2211.03050_2393279c2076077c18e3dcba31cc5: which returns the irreversible entropy production in the standard thermodynamics
elements.2211.03050_90261079302e14e0349e667be41c9: In this sense, the second law statement that the irreversible entropy keeps increasing could be equivalently understood as the increase of total correlation in this whole system
elements.2211.03050_6f1a30831ba904a7dcd352ad88c15: Another analogy with the standard thermodynamics is the Boltzmann entropy increase in an isolated classical gas composed of

elements.2211.03050_bad20c91b83955092a4e1a3795bdd: of each single particle always approaches the Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution (
elements.2211.03050_ad6282179335cea9006d3f70b6b90: ) as the steady state, with its entropy increasing monotonically

elements.2211.03050_086767e466c526fb4e303a160cbbc: In this case the total correlation of the

elements.2211.03050_0ee607840800320de9fbbfe9d3a5b: Therefore, the total correlation reduces to the entropy production in the standard thermodynamics

elements.2211.03050_4f662b338da37db9dd87683d8e4b4: The total correlation approximately exhibits a monotonic increasing behavior, which is similar to the irreversible entropy increase in the standard thermodynamics
elements.2211.03050_5d1d88b496b3615ca7c785588b9ca: Even for the strong coupling situation where the total excitation has violent fluctuations, the total excitation exhibits an explicit converging behavior until the recurrence happens.We also show that in most common physical conditions, the correlational entropy production could reduce to the standard entropy production based on the thermal entropy
elements.2211.03050_a37cd48965442084197ac8825b7ea: In this sense, the correlational entropy production is a well generalization for the standard entropy production.
